# StepContent API

<p className="description">The API documentation of the StepContent React component. Learn more about the props and the CSS customization points.</p>

## Import

```js
import StepContent from '@material-ui/core/StepContent';
// or
import { StepContent } from '@material-ui/core';
```

You can learn more about the difference by [reading this guide](/guides/minimizing-bundle-size/).



## Props

| Name | Type | Default | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| <span className="prop-name">children</span> | <span className="prop-type">node</span> |  | Step content. |
| <span className="prop-name">classes</span> | <span className="prop-type">object</span> |  | Override or extend the styles applied to the component. See [CSS API](#css) below for more details. |
| <span className="prop-name">TransitionComponent</span> | <span className="prop-type">elementType</span> | <span className="prop-default">Collapse</span> | The component used for the transition. |
| <span className="prop-name">transitionDuration</span> | <span className="prop-type">number<br />&#124;&nbsp;{ enter?: number, exit?: number }<br />&#124;&nbsp;'auto'</span> | <span className="prop-default">'auto'</span> | Adjust the duration of the content expand transition. Passed as a prop to the transition component.<br />Set to 'auto' to automatically calculate transition time based on height. |
| <span className="prop-name">TransitionProps</span> | <span className="prop-type">object</span> |  | Props applied to the `Transition` element. |

The `ref` is forwarded to the root element.

Any other props supplied will be provided to the root element (native element).

## CSS

- Style sheet name: `MuiStepContent`.
- Style sheet details:

| Rule name | Global class | Description |
|:-----|:-------------|:------------|
| <span className="prop-name">root</span> | <span className="prop-name">MuiStepContent-root</span> | Styles applied to the root element.
| <span className="prop-name">last</span> | <span className="prop-name">MuiStepContent-last</span> | Styles applied to the root element if `last={true}` (controlled by `Step`).
| <span className="prop-name">transition</span> | <span className="prop-name">MuiStepContent-transition</span> | Styles applied to the Transition component.

You can override the style of the component thanks to one of these customization points:

- With a rule name of the [`classes` object prop](/customization/components/#overriding-styles-with-classes).
- With a [global class name](/customization/components/#overriding-styles-with-global-class-names).
- With a theme and an [`overrides` property](/customization/globals/#css).

If that's not sufficient, you can check the [implementation of the component](https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/blob/master/packages/material-ui/src/StepContent/StepContent.js) for more detail.
